definitions.definition: involving or relating to most or all people, things, or places, especially when these are considered as a unit:
examples: The general feeling is that justice was not served.
In general, men are taller than women.

definitions.definition: considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of him, her, or it:
examples: So, apart from the bad ankle, how are you in general?

definitions.definition: to be a good thing for the public:
examples: The government will only say it is not in the general interest to reveal any more information.

definitions.definition: an officer of very high rank, especially in the army:
examples: He was promoted to the rank of general.
